# Accessibility Support

This document outlines SynthFlow's commitment to accessibility and the features provided to ensure the language and its tools are usable by developers with disabilities.

## Overview

SynthFlow is committed to creating an inclusive development environment that accommodates developers with various abilities and disabilities. This includes accessible language design, development tools, and documentation.

## Language Design Accessibility

### Visual Accessibility

#### High Contrast Support
- Syntax highlighting themes with high contrast ratios
- Customizable color schemes for different visual impairments
- Dark and light mode options
- Colorblind-friendly palettes

#### Font and Text Features
- Scalable font sizes in all tools
- Support for screen readers
- Clear typography with good spacing
- Monospaced fonts for code consistency

#### Visual Indicators
- Multiple visual cues for important information
- Icons with text labels
- Consistent visual hierarchy
- Reduced motion options

### Keyboard Navigation

#### Full Keyboard Support
- Complete keyboard navigation for all IDE features
- Standard keyboard shortcuts
- Customizable key bindings
- Focus indicators for interactive elements

#### Screen Reader Compatibility
- Semantic markup in documentation
- ARIA labels for interactive components
- Descriptive alternative text
- Logical tab order

## Development Tools Accessibility

### IDE Accessibility Features

#### Visual Studio Code Extension
- Compatible with VS Code accessibility features
- Support for accessibility themes
- Keyboard shortcut customization
- Integrated screen reader support

#### Command-Line Interface
- Clear, consistent output formatting
- High contrast color schemes
- Verbose mode for detailed information
- Error messages with context

### Compiler Accessibility

#### Error Reporting
- Descriptive error messages with clear explanations
- Multiple output formats (text, JSON)
- Suggested fixes for common errors
- Links to relevant documentation

#### Diagnostic Information
- Detailed diagnostic output when requested
- Structured error information
- Context-sensitive help
- Progressive disclosure of information

## Documentation Accessibility

### Format Support
- Multiple documentation formats (HTML, PDF, EPUB)
- Semantic HTML structure
- Proper heading hierarchy
- Alternative text for images

### Reading Features
- Adjustable text size
- High contrast modes
- Dyslexia-friendly fonts
- Text-to-speech compatibility

### Navigation
- Clear site structure
- Breadcrumb navigation
- Search functionality
- Skip navigation links

## Cognitive Accessibility

### Simplified Interfaces
- Progressive disclosure of complexity
- Consistent interaction patterns
- Clear labeling of controls
- Predictable behavior

### Learning Support
- Tutorial sequences with guided steps
- Error recovery assistance
- Context-sensitive help
- Example code with explanations

### Customization
- Adjustable complexity levels
- Personalized workflows
- Preference persistence
- User profile settings

## Motor Accessibility

### Alternative Input Methods
- Full keyboard navigation
- Voice control compatibility
- Switch control support
- Eye tracking compatibility

### Reduced Interaction Requirements
- Keyboard shortcuts for common actions
- Macro recording and playback
- Batch operations
- Template systems

### Touch Interface
- Appropriate touch target sizes
- Gestural shortcuts
- Multi-touch support
- Haptic feedback

## Hearing Accessibility

### Audio Alternatives
- Visual alternatives for audio cues
- Captions for video content
- Transcript availability
- Visual status indicators

### Notification Systems
- Visual notifications
- Vibration alerts (mobile)
- Customizable alert types
- Priority-based filtering

## Assistive Technology Compatibility

### Screen Readers
- NVDA compatibility (Windows)
- JAWS compatibility (Windows)
- VoiceOver compatibility (macOS/iOS)
- Orca compatibility (Linux)

### Magnification Tools
- ZoomText compatibility
- Windows Magnifier
- macOS Zoom
- Linux desktop magnifiers

### Voice Recognition
- Dragon NaturallySpeaking compatibility
- Windows Speech Recognition
- macOS Dictation
- Open source voice recognition tools

## Testing and Validation

### Accessibility Testing
- Automated accessibility testing tools
- Manual testing with assistive technologies
- User testing with disabled community
- Regular accessibility audits

### Compliance Standards
- WCAG 2.1 AA compliance
- Section 508 compliance
- EN 301 549 compliance
- Local accessibility regulations

### Quality Assurance
- Accessibility test plans
- Regression testing for accessibility
- Performance impact assessment
- User experience evaluation

## Implementation Roadmap

### Phase 1: Foundation (v0.3.0)
- Basic accessibility framework
- High contrast themes

- Screen reader basics

### Phase 2: Enhancement (v0.6.0)
- Full WCAG compliance
- Advanced customization options
- Comprehensive documentation accessibility
- Community testing program

### Phase 3: Optimization (v1.0.0)
- Advanced assistive technology support
- Cognitive accessibility features
- Performance optimization
- Full community integration

This accessibility support framework ensures that SynthFlow creates an inclusive environment where all developers, regardless of their abilities, can effectively use the language and its tools.
